title: sagar11003
author: sagar11003
content: Everyone know Russian businessman are using cryptocurrency. But no one ask how they turn Russian ruble to cryptocurrency? They use Sberbank and in exchange they took Webmoney. Not only Sberbank Russian Post, Russian card and wire transfer is also available to turn them into Webmoney. And here comes 1Xbet, they are accepting Webmoney. Webmoney giving everyone 12% to 20% and even more. So customers are refusing every payment method and taking Webmoney giving USDT,USDC type stable coin. If you give them cryptocurrency they will give you best extra % they can. And that's how Russia is using their brain again and collect their war money. They are doing is silently. 17 August they exchange 980977.93 WMZ only by exchanging USDT, they have other payment option as well. Is their any way it can be stopped? ? ?

comments.author: BADecker
comments.body: Banning Webmoney will only serve to hurt everybody. But it will improve relations between Iran and Russia. Russia and Iran have been friends for a long time. But sanctions are improving their ties.Russia and Iran are cementing an alliance amid global sanctionsQuote from: https://www.naturalnews.com/2022-08-31-russia-iran-cementing-alliance-amid-global-sanctions.html#Two of America’s biggest rivals – Iran and Russia – are cementing stronger ties as their isolation from the international world stage is driving them to conduct more trade and military and scientific cooperation.The deliberate isolation of Russia with sanctions following its invasion of Ukraine has only accelerated efforts to bring Russia and Iran together. Both countries have often talked of establishing closer ties in the past, with few concrete results. (Related: Epic fail: Joe Biden’s sanctions have actually benefited the Russian economy.)But now that extreme Russian sanctions have cut off many of the Russian economy’s former ties with the West, it has turned to Iran to help both countries mitigate the impact of sanctions by mutually finding new markets for their products.Since the start of the year, bilateral trade between Russia and Iran has gone up by 10 percent. Some of the new deals being negotiated by Iranian and Russian traders include Iran selling clothing to Russian retailers to replace the disappearing Western brands and Iranian factories providing Russian car makers with automotive spare parts.Perhaps more importantly, in July, Iran surpassed Egypt and Turkey to become Russia’s largest wheat buyer, receiving nearly 400,000 tons of wheat that month, more than double what the other two countries receive.“Iran can only buy wheat from a limited number of sources,” said Masha Belikova, a London-based grains analyst. “When the war started, Russia was targeted by sanctions and faced payments issues. Iran was one of the few countries ready to accept” the political risk of continuing to trade with Russia.Russia, Iran also agree on closer military cooperationPerhaps more alarming to the United States is the increased military cooperation between Russia and Iran.Back in June, American intelligence alleged that Iran hosted a Russian delegation to showcase the country’s attack drones. Intelligence further claims that Iran is training Russian soldiers to use Iranian military technology in Ukraine....

comments.body: "Money laundering" is simply a term that somebody tries to use to take away your freedom to make and use any kind of money you want.If Russia had some kind of agreements with the US and other countries of the world to use the USD, those agreements were destroyed by the US and the other countries when they did the sanctions against Russia.Of course, we are seeing that the sanctions failed, and actually became things of great benefit for Russia. But since Russia is not allowed to use the USD, and since the contracts for using it are broken, there is no money laundering involved in whatever ways they use whatever money.What? Do you expect Russia to simply roll over and die? Are you asking their people to all commit suicide? They are free... to themselves. And they are using their freedom to build a prosperous world for themselves. If other countries want to destroy themselves by attempting to take away Russian freedom, that's up to them.
